abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Petroleum
            Technical Assistance Project is to assist Kazakhstan to
            strengthen the capacity of the key petroleum subsector
            agencies to: 1) attract foreign investments into the
            subsector; 2) promote the efficiency and long-term financial
            viability of the petroleum industries; and 3) formulate
            economically sound investment and organizational strategies
            for the integration of domestic primary petroleum
            production, processing, transport, and distribution. The
            project consists of two components: Institutional
            Development, and Project Preparation and Implementation
            Support. The first, has three subcomponents:  1) supporting
            the creation of an effective framework for promoting foreign
            investments in the petroleum subsector by assisting in
            finalizing a petroleum law and formulating a tax code,
            appraising potential investment projects, and structuring
            and negotiating transactions with prospective investors, and
            training local staff;   2) assisting the implementation of a
            program corporatizing and restructuring the petroleum
            industry, and preparing the basis for increased private
            sector participation; and  3) assisting in identifying and
            addressing priority management training needs, and preparing
            and administering training in market-oriented petroleum
            industry operational and commercial practices. The second
            component also has three subcomponents:  1) planned studies
            reviewing the economic feasibility of constructing new
            product pipelines and a crude oil pipeline connecting
            oilfields in the west with the two refineries in the east;
            2) assisting the assessment of regional and domestic market
            potential for natural gas, and the supply and investment
            options for participating in meeting the demand; and  3)
            providing advisory and consultant services to manage the
            day-to-day project's implementation.
